perturbation.original_text: Oxbow and Global each may be referred to from time to time herein as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties".
perturbation.changed_text: Oxbow and Global each may be referred to from time to time herein as a "Party" and collectively as the "Organizations".
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Parties" and "Organizations" are used interchangeably, which can cause confusion as to whether they are the same or distinct entities. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty in the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
Confidential Information shall not be used for any purpose other than to evaluate and consummate the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, and shall not be disclosed without prior written consent of the other Party, except to:

    (i) those employees with a need to know the Confidential Information for the purpose of performing work related to the transactions contemplated by this Agreement; provided, however that the Parties shall require all such employees receiving the Confidential Information abide by the terms of this confidentiality covenant. Each Party shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by its employees or Affiliates; or

    (ii) those advisors, agents, contractors or lenders with a need to know the Confidential Information for the purpose of performing work related to the transactions contemplated by this Agreement; provided, however that the Parties shall require all such advisors, agents, contractors or lenders to agree to abide by the terms of this Agreement and to undertake the same obligations as the Parties have undertaken hereunder. Each Party shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by its advisors, agents, contractors or lenders.
perturbation.changed_text:
Confidential Information shall not be used for any purpose other than to evaluate and consummate the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, and shall not be disclosed without prior written consent of the other Party, except to:

    (i) those staff members with a need to know the Confidential Information for the purpose of performing work related to the transactions contemplated by this Agreement; provided, however that the Parties shall require all such staff members receiving the Confidential Information abide by the terms of this confidentiality covenant. Each Party shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by its staff members or Affiliates; or

    (ii) those consultants, representatives, contractors or lenders with a need to know the Confidential Information for the purpose of performing work related to the transactions contemplated by this Agreement; provided, however that the Parties shall require all such consultants, representatives, contractors or lenders to agree to abide by the terms of this Agreement and to undertake the same obligations as the Parties have undertaken hereunder. Each Party shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by its consultants, representatives, contractors or lenders.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'employees' and 'staff members' are used interchangeably, as well as 'advisors' and 'consultants', and 'agents' and 'representatives', creating an internal contradiction as to whether they refer to the exact same roles or if there's a differentiation, leading to confusion and potentially conflicting interpretations of the contract.

perturbation.original_text: In the event either Party files an action to enforce or otherwise arising out of this Agreement, the prevailing Party in such action shall be entitled to reasonable attorneys' fees and court costs in addition to such other relief to which it may be entitled.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event either Party files an action to enforce or otherwise arising out of this Agreement, the successful Organization in such action will receive reimbursement for legal expenses and court fees.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'prevailing Party' to 'successful Organization' and 'attorneys' fees and court costs' to 'reimbursement for legal expenses and court fees', this introduces ambiguity. It is unclear if 'Organization' has same legal standing as 'Party' or if 'reimbursement' covers same scope of costs and fees, which could lead to disagreement over financial obligations after a legal action.
